description: The Mediterranean Hackberry is an amazing evergreen tree that can be found in warmer climates. It grows quickly and can reach heights of up to 25 meters, with a wide canopy forming an attractive shade. The leaves are ovate shaped with a leathery texture and are deep green in the summer and a dull yellow in the winter. The flowers are small, greenish-white, in clusters, followed by small orange-red fruit. This fruit is amazingly edible, and can be enjoyed in jams, jellies, and wines. Additionally, the hard wood of the tree is also highly valued as it can be used in furniture making and flooring. It is also an amazing source of nectar for honeybees.
